top_comment.text: That baby is going to be so good looking holy shittt﻿
top_comment.author: Jordan Blackburn

comments.text:
+Mariam Tausif I overall agree with you. But I think that their son won't 
be "beautiful" because of his parents. He will be just who he is, that's 
it. And nowadays' society sucks most of the times.
comments.author: Vylkeer

comments.text:
+Vylkeer I think that you're right about the "beauty is a personal opinion 
thing", but I don't really know about the other stuff. Beauty's not 
genetic, but certain traits are. It's more a matter of how the features 
blend and how to not downplay your own beauty. No one is truly ugly, they 
just need to be confident, but not cocky, and make their most flattering 
feature(s) the most eye-catching. And as for the whole "Their kids will be 
beautiful thing"? They will. Just not because of their genes. Besides the 
idea of beauty in society has changed throughout the generations. For 
example, in one ancient civilization I learned about a couple of months 
ago, I believe that it was Mesopotamia, the heavier a woman was, the more 
beautiful and capable wife she was. It is a matter of opinion. When some of 
society looks at a woman today, they judge a lot of things, such as her 
figure, her features, her weight, her clothes, her voice, her shoes and 
even nails, because all some of us care about is presentation. And while 
presentation is important, you should look at a person's achievements, 
goals and aspirations, morals, etc.
However, it's not just us women who do this. Men do too, believe it or not. 
From The Upper East Side to The Trailer Park. Like if a guy has a tattoo, 
he's either dangerous, makes bad decisions, or extremely masculine. What if 
he just wanted a reminder of something important to him? Or even the same 
with a woman? There's a lot of women who get tattoos to have a physical 
reminder of a miscarriage/ stillborn child / any loved one who has passed 
on.
To put it bluntly, society sucks sometimes ☺.
comments.author: Mariam Tausif

comments.text:
+Prithvi Kalyan What the fuck do you want? I'm just saying that Jaden 
definitely is not growing that much, even I was already taller at his age. 
He is 170 cm at 16 years old. I'm not trying to hate, it's just the truth. 
I know until when people can grow, in fact I'm 20 and I could stil grow for 
1 year more since people can grow up to 21 and in some cases even 22 years 
old. So think twice before even talking. The fact that the father is tall 
doesn't mean the son will be as well.

comments.author: Vylkeer

comments.text: That baby is going to be attractive and it will be tall…it could be a model!
comments.author: Michelle Gibson

comments.text:
+shamasi1968 I never said that people don't acquire their physical traits 
from their parents or family members. But "beauty" is not a gene nor a 
genoma so it can't be transferred or inherited as it's a subjective and 
personal matter. So even if their child will indeed have body features and 
aspects similar to his parents, that doesn't mean he will be good-looking 
or beautiful. Every person will have their own opinion. The fact that his 
parents are considered good-looking by most people, not even everyone, 
doesn't guarantee him to be defined the same way. So my comment wasn't off 
base at all.
comments.author: Vylkeer

comments.text: +Eric Cartman Not according to the list... Hey, wanna buy some pubes?
comments.author: Far shot

comments.text:
+Vylkeer Your first comment is way off base, genetics do indeed have much 
to do with how someone looks. are you going to tell us that you have no 
features that resemble someone else in your family? Even if it is not your 
immediate family you most likely resemble one ancestor or another. That 
said, children don't always look like their parents, sometimes they look 
like grandparents, aunts, etc.. Or in some cases they may get a mix of the 
parents features that don't blend into "beauty" as those features did for 
the parents.
comments.author: shamasi1968

comments.text: pfft! I'm the hottest lookin' grade. 4 kid out there!

comments.text:
Actually Vylkeer is right, and he's aide it in the nicest way possible too 
but everyone's coming at him because you don't see what he's trying to say. 
Beauty is not in someone's genes, it's all opinion. Something can be 
pleasing to look at to one person, and displeasing to the other. Once 
again, it's all opinion. At least try and have an open mind about what he's 
trying to say instead of being hard headed and saying he's wrong because of 
what media says is beautiful (-.-)"
comments.author: Emily Roman

comments.text:
+Jordan Blackburn I'm not stating that. I'm saying that the word "good 
looking" is pretty misleading as there isn't really a proper and objective 
definition of it. You can say that pen is red and it's true because it's a 
fact but when it comes to beauty, things get a little bit trickier and 
there's not the definitive opinion of it. I find Mila and Ashton to be 
pretty good-looking people, in that sense, but someone else might think 
that they're ugly as hell or some other people that they're "hot".
comments.author: Vylkeer

comments.text:

captions.text:
- MAYBE YOUR LITTLE GIRL
WILL TURN OUT TO BE A DANCER.

- MAYBE.
MAYBE SHE COULD DANCE.
SHE COULD DO ANYTHING SHE WANTS.

- ANYTHING SHE WANTS TO DO.
[laughter]
SHE'S GONNA BE SPOILED ROTTEN.

HER NAME IS WYATT.
- YES.

- AND SHE'S, WHAT,
TWO MONTHS OLD NOW?
- UH, YEAH, A LITTLE BIT--

LIKE, A LITTLE BIT OLDER
THAN TWO MONTHS.
LIKE, 2 1/2 MONTHS ALMOST, YEAH.
[laughter]
TWO MONTHS, 12 DAYS.

- SO MILA IS--
- I'M NOT COUNTING.

- [chuckles]
AND YOU HAVE NO NANNY?

IT'S JUST MILA AND YOU
TAKING CARE OF THE BABY?

- YEAH, IT'S JUST
THE TWO OF US.

- WOW.
- IT'S AWESOME.

IT'S UNBELIEVABLE.
- GOOD FOR YOU.
[cheers and applause]
- I WANT TO--YOU KNOW--
IT'S INCREDIBLE.

YOU KNOW, YOU GET--
LIKE, WHEN YOU FIRST GET THEM,

IT'S, YOU'RE ALL EXCITED,
AND YOU'RE, LIKE, READY TO,

LIKE, DO ALL THESE THINGS,
AND YOU HAVE ALL THESE DREAMS,

AND THEN YOU REALIZE IT'S LIKE
GETTING A NEW CELL PHONE

WHERE ALL THE FEATURES
DON'T WORK YET.

IT'S LIKE A PHONE THAT, LIKE,
DOESN'T HAVE--
IT WON'T TAKE PICTURES.

IT'S LIKE, WHY DOES MY NEW
PHONE NOT TAKE PICTURES?

AND IT WON'T MAKE CALLS,
AND IT DOESN'T DO A LOT.
BUT IT LOOKS REALLY CUTE.
[laughter]

- BUT EVERY DAY,
THERE MUST BE A NEW THING--

THAT SHE'S FOCUSING
AND GRASPING.
- YEAH, IT'S UNBELIEVABLE.

SHE FOUND HERSELF
IN THE MIRROR

AND REALIZED SHE WAS ABLE
TO CONTROL THE THING
IN THE MIRROR...

- WOW.
- WHICH WAS PRETTY COOL.

- YEAH, IT WAS--
BUT THE MOST AMAZING THING

ABOUT HAVING A BABY IS
MY PARTNER, MILA.
SHE'S THE GREATEST MOM.
I CAN'T EVEN--
LIKE, I GO TO WORK EVERY DAY,

AND I COME HOME,
AND SHE'S, LIKE, PERFECT,

AND IT JUST SEEMS LIKE
EVERYTHING WENT AMAZING.
[laughter]

AND I KNOW THAT SOMETHING
PROBABLY DIDN'T GO AMAZING,

BUT SHE NEVER COM--
LIKE, IT'S UNBELIEVABLE.
SHE'S INCREDIBLE.

I'M REALLY LUCKY.
- THAT'S AMAZING.

WELL, GOOD FOR HER,
AND GOOD FOR YOU
FOR RECOGNIZING THAT.

[applause]
THAT'S HARD.

I MEAN, SHE DOESN'T HAVE TO
STAY HOME AND DO THAT, AND--
I MEAN, YOU COULD HIRE A NANNY,

BUT YOU WANT TO DO IT--
YOU WANT TO--

- YEAH, WE JUST WANT TO KNOW
OUR KID,

AND WE WANT--
LIKE, WE WANT TO BE THE PEOPLE

THAT KNOW WHAT TO DO TO--
WHEN THE BABY'S CRYING

TO MAKE THE BABY NOT CRY
ANYMORE.

WE WANT TO KNOW, LIKE,
WHEN SHE MAKES A LITTLE FACE

OR A LITTLE SOMETHING
OR DOES A LITTLE--

LIKE, WE WANT TO BE
EMOTIONALLY IN TOUCH WITH HER,

AND I THINK THE ONLY WAY
YOU CAN DO THAT

IS BY BEING THE ONE
WHO'S THERE.
AND THAT'S IT.

- AND WHAT'S THE HARDEST THING
THAT--

WHAT SURPRISED YOU THE MOST
ABOUT IT?

YOU KNOW, IT'S JUST HOW MUCH
YOU CAN LOVE ANOTHER PERSON.
LIKE, YOU THINK YOU KNOW

HOW MUCH YOU CAN LOVE
ANOTHER PERSON,

AND THEN YOU HAVE A CHILD,
AND THEN YOU REALIZE
YOU DIDN'T KNOW.
AND--AND IT'S--

IT'S, LIKE,
INFINITELY REWARDING.

THERE'S A GREAT QUOTE
BY CARLOS SLIM,

AND HE SAID, "MOST PEOPLE THINK
THAT THEY NEED TO

"MAKE A BETTER WORLD
FOR THEIR CHILDREN,
"BUT THE REALITY IS,

WE JUST NEED TO MAKE
BETTER CHILDREN FOR OUR WORLD."
AND I TRY TO LIVE BY THAT.

AND I THINK--
I REALLY--

LIKE, I LOOK AT THIS AS
THE GREATEST OPPORTUNITY
OF MY LIFE.
- WOW. GREAT.
[applause]
AND I AGREE WITH THAT.

I BELIEVE THE CHILDREN
ARE OUR FUTURE,

AND WE TEACH THEM WELL
AND LET THEM LEAD THE WAY
IS WHAT I BELIEVE.
[laughter]
I'VE ALWAYS SAID IT.
SO NOW, IT MUST BE HARD THOUGH,

BECAUSE YOU CAN'T POSSIBLY
LEAVE THE HOUSE.

I MEAN, 'CAUSE PAPARAZZI--
FIRST OF ALL,

THE TWO OF YOU ARE HOUNDED,
BUT NOW YOU'VE GOT A BABY,
AND, OH, PAPARAZZI LOVE BABIES.

- YEAH, I MEAN, WE HAVE, LIKE,
ALL THESE COOL TOYS.

LIKE, WE GOT A LOT OF GIFTS
FROM PEOPLE
THAT ARE SUPER GENEROUS,
AND WE HAVE ALL THESE COOL TOYS,

AND WE DON'T GET TO USE THEM
ALL.
LIKE--YOU KNOW, LIKE A--

I WOULD LIKE TO JUST USE
THE STROLLER ONCE,

BUT, LIKE, WE DON'T GET TO GO
TO THE MALL AND STROLL.

- MM-MM.
[laughter]
- SO I'M LIKE--I HAVE--

AND I'VE ASSEMBLED
A LOT OF THINGS

THAT WE HAVEN'T GOTTEN TO USE
YET.

AND SO I'M JUST
ASSEMBLING THINGS, ELLEN.

[laughter]
- YOU'RE A MAN.
YOU'RE A MAN ASSEMBLING THINGS.
- I'M AN ASSEMBLER.
[applause]

- SO YOU'RE HUDDLED TOGETHER
INDOORS,
YOU AND MILA AND WYATT--
- [laughing]

YOU MAKE IT SOUND LIKE
WE'RE IN A CABIN.

WE'RE HUDDLED AROUND A FIRE
HOLDING THE BABY.

- WELL, 'CAUSE YOU CAN'T LEAVE.
WHAT DO YOU DO INSIDE?

WHAT DO YOU DO?
- [chuckles]

UM...
[laughter]

YOU KNOW, I'VE WATCHED
MORE TELEVISION

THAN I'VE EVER WATCHED
IN THE LAST COUPLE MONTHS.
- WHAT ARE YOU WATCHING?

- WE STARTED WATCHING
"THE VOICE."

- "THE VOICE" IS GOOD.
- IT'S AMAZING.
- "THE VOICE" IS GOOD.
- THOSE PEOPLE ARE SO TALENTED.
THEY'RE SO TALENTED, THESE KIDS.

AND WE HAVE THESE--
WE HAVE FUNNY CONVERSATIONS

ABOUT, LIKE, "GOD,
DIDN'T GWEN LOOK GREAT TONIGHT?"

AND, LIKE, WE FEEL LIKE
WE'RE FRIENDS WITH GWEN.
AND THAT'S FUN.
AND THEN, YOU KNOW, WE'RE--
OH, WE WERE WATCHING THIS--

WE STARTED WATCHING THIS SHOW
CALLED "UTOPIA."
- I TRIED TO WATCH THAT.

- I THINK
WE WERE THE ONLY ONES IN AMERICA
THAT WERE WATCHING IT, AND--

'CAUSE I WOULD, LIKE,
TRY TO ENGAGE FRIENDS.

LIKE,
"OH, DID YOU SEE 'UTOPIA'?"

AND THEY WERE LIKE,
"NO, WE DIDN'T.

THAT'S NOT--THAT'S NOT
ONE OF THE COOL SHOWS."

SO IT GOT CANCELED.
- RIGHT.
[laughter]

- AND THEN--AND THAT WAS, LIKE,
THE FIRST SHOW

THAT I REALLY LOVED TO WATCH
THAT GOT CANCELED.

IT WAS LIKE--REMEMBER WHEN BECKY
DISAPPEARED FROM "ROSEANNE"?
IT WAS LIKE THAT.

- OH, YEAH.
[laughter]
- SHE WAS JUST GONE.

- IT'S NOT--
IT'S NOT THAT BAD.
YOU NEED PRIVACY.

YOU SAID YOU WANTED
TO BE ABLE TO WALK YOUR BABY.

SO LOOK AT THIS.
WATCH THIS.

ALL RIGHT.
- WHAT?
- YOU BRING THE BABY OUT.
THE BABY'S COMFORTABLE.
AND THEN IT'S...

[laughter]
PAPARAZZI-FREE.
- I NEED ONE OF THOSE FOR ME.
- I KNOW. ALL OF YOU.

HOW GREAT--AND IT'S
A REALLY GOOD STROLLER TOO.

- THAT'S INCREDIBLE.
THANK YOU SO MUCH.

[cheers and applause]
THANK YOU SO MUCH.
- YOU'RE WELCOME.

title: Ashton Kutcher on His New Baby
